p: Long‐term management of SMO inhibitor‐related toxicities has been evaluated with visomdegib and sonidegib in patients with advanced basal cell carcinoma. 56, 57 The use of dose adjustments and interruptions to manage AEs have contributed to long treatment exposures and sustained clinical responses for these agents. 56, 57 Therefore, it will be critical to evaluate the long‐term safety of glasdegib and potentially apply similar strategies for AE management in patients with AML or high‐risk MDS.
